text: - As a leader in sustainable

and innovative building
solutions, we realized that
by embracing the cloud
and also AI, that we would be able

to rapidly deliver
solutions to the business
that can have a meaningful impact.
Holcim saw that by embracing the cloud,
we could improve customer service,

drive operational excellence with
a specific focus on safety.
As a part of our cloud migration,
we have a strategic priority
to upskill and reskill our people.
We collaborated with AWS

to implement the
AWS Skills Guild framework.

This is a comprehensive
skills enablement program
that was able to reach hundreds
of our employees around the world.

- We had the opportunity to do
the generative AI courses.

This helps us understand
the technology

and how things
are working underneath.

- I had the opportunity to
attend two technical sessions.
I also attended the hackathon,
and this was a great opportunity to open

my mind about what
generative AI was.

I think, the first
thing, is that we all let

that flow, our imagination,
just to realize the power
of generative AI.

At the end of the day, we are
starting just to give life
to those potential solutions
that maybe can happen in our company.
- The positive impacts

that the program has had are
boosting our time to market,
improving resiliency,

and delivering cost savings
to the organization.

One of the great benefits
that came out of the

I&O Skills Guild was
the Omnivore project,

which was actually a
byproduct of the AI hackathon
between Madrid and Zug.

Omnivore leverages Amazon's
Bedrock AI language models

to drive invoice
classification and routing.
- We have incoming invoices.

We read them and then we sort
them into different streams
as well as we do some confidence checks.

Everything is run on an LLM
system done by Amazon Bedrock.

Before we had one person
doing it completely manually,

and now we have it done
completely automatic.

We reduced around 90% of the
manual work that we did have

to do before, meaning this
one employee is now able
to free up the time for other projects
that bring more value.

One very important part was
the I&O team playing here

because they were the enablers
of my side of the business
to actually do a project like Omnivore.
And I think an important part for them is

that they have been upskilled
through the AWS Skills Guild.

- The platform that we
have been working on
for the last two years is the one
that let us really take action
and move the knowledge to really improve

and deliver solutions that are
scalable in our organization.
- In Omnivore, we did it in four months.

And I think this sets us
apart in general from a lot
of other proof of concepts.
It's not a proof of concept anymore,
but it is in live production.
For me, Omnivore was a catalyst,
but the possibilities are endless.
